intro: Hieracium flavistylum var. perustum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosette. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are often lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
